title: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details, Havre", June 5, 1887
medium: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 12; bottom right corner: 13; clockwise from upper left: spire on church; Dormer / overhanging roof; HAVRE / June 5 - 1887.
description: Vertical sheet depicting six sketches of architectural elements and ornament.  At top left is a spire with an octagonal cupola and finial.  At the top right is a dormer that greatly overhangs the window below and is supported by two brackets mounted to either side of the window.  Below this ia another dormer that overhangs and is supported by a row of three brackets above the windows.  Below left is another dormer that overhangs, although the bottom is canted back and the trusses are visible on the underside.  Finally at lower left is another example of a roof overhang visibly supported by brackets underneath.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details, Havre", June 5, 1887.Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-186.
